thread.title: Moment MPs were told about the shooting outside Parliament
thread.title_full: Moment MPs were told about the shooting outside Parliament

author: Nicole Morley
title: Moment MPs were told about the shooting outside Parliament
text:
&&&&& To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
Parliament has been suspended after gunfire was reported outside. 
Scotland Yard have confirmed they have been called to a firearms incident on Westminster Bridge, where several people have been injured.
Several injured after gunshots are fired outside Houses of Parliament Commons Leader David Lidington has told MPs a ‘police officer has been stabbed’.
He added that the ‘alleged assailant was shot by armed police’ following a ‘serious’ incident within the parliamentary estate.
The clip from inside the chambers shows the moment MPs were told about the shooting.
The moment MPs were told about the incident The sitting of the House was suspended, though politicians were advised to stay put for their own safety.
A man with a knife was reported within the confines of Westminster Palace, according to eyewitnesses.
A Reuters photographer claims he saw at least a dozen people injured after a car ploughed into pedestrians on Westminster Bridge.
A Downing Street source declined to say where Theresa May had been during the attack, but said she had not been involved.
